description: Advanced Cost and Usage Analysis Dashboard

options.content:
Cost Optimization And Savings Tool (COAST)
for Amazon Managed Grafana

COAST is a set of customizable Amazon Managed Grafana dashboards which provide a summary view as well as granular service level views based on the AWS Cost and Usage Report (CUR). Dashboards include specific views tailored for executive leadership, FinOps Practitioners and DevOps/Engineering.

The Executuve Dashboard is a powerful tool that empowers your organization to take control of cloud costs, optimize spending, and make data-driven financial decisions. By leveraging its capabilities, you can ensure that your cloud resources are not only efficient but also cost-effective.

If you have any questions or need further assistance in interpreting the data or utilizing the dashboard's features, please reach out to your designated Cloud Financial Analyst or FinOps Manager for guidance and support.

About this Dashboard
The FinOps Dashboard is a comprehensive tool designed specifically for the Cloud Center of Excellence and FinOps practitioners within your organization. Its primary objective is to offer a convenient and insightful way to manage and analyze cloud spending, enabling informed financial decisions related to your cloud infrastructure.

Key Features and Benefits:
  • Invoice Spend Tracking: One of the central features of this dashboard is its ability to meticulously track invoice spend. By aggregating and visualizing invoice data, it provides a clear and detailed overview of your organization's financial commitments, helping you ensure that your cloud resources stay within budget.
  • General Spend Summaries: In addition to invoice spend, this dashboard offers general spend summaries. It provides an overview of how resources across various accounts are being utilized and where costs are incurred. This high-level view helps in identifying trends and optimizing spending patterns.
  • Commitment-Based Spend: A critical aspect of cloud cost management is commitment-based spending. The dashboard includes specialized views and insights into your organization's commitments and usage. By tracking commitments, you can ensure that your cloud resources align with your organization's budgetary goals.
  • Multi-Account Support: We recommend using this dashboard at the payer level, allowing you to monitor and manage spend and usage across all linked accounts. This comprehensive view ensures that all accounts are aligned with your financial objectives, enabling better control and optimization.

How to Utilize this Dashboard
To make the most of the FinOps Dashboard, consider the following steps:
  • Regular Monitoring: Regularly review the dashboard to monitor your organization's cloud spend. Keep a close eye on invoice spend, commitments, and general summaries to identify any discrepancies or areas where cost savings can be achieved.
  • Cost Optimization: Use the insights provided by the dashboard to optimize your cloud resources. Identify areas where resource usage can be scaled down or reconfigured to reduce costs without compromising performance.
  • Commitment Management: Manage your commitment-based spend effectively by tracking your commitments and ensuring that they align with actual usage. The dashboard provides data to help you make informed decisions about adjustments to commitments.
  • Collaboration: Share the dashboard with relevant teams and stakeholders within your organization. Encourage collaboration between finance, IT, and operations teams to jointly manage and optimize cloud costs.
  • Periodic Reviews: Schedule periodic reviews and discussions based on the information presented in the dashboard. This helps in aligning cloud spending with your organization's evolving needs and financial goals.
The FinOps Dashboard is a powerful tool that empowers your organization to take control of cloud costs, optimize spending, and make data-driven financial decisions. By leveraging its capabilities, you can ensure that your cloud resources are not only efficient but also cost-effective.

If you have any questions or need further assistance in interpreting the data or utilizing the dashboard's features, please reach out to your designated Cloud Financial Analyst or FinOps Manager for guidance and support.

The Required Columns Validator evaluates your CUR dataset to confirm the presence of essential columns. For the dashboard to operate accurately, the CUR dataset must include columns for:

  • Reservations - When acquiring a reservation, specific columns are appended to the CUR. Many of our queries rely on these columns to accurately represent your spend.
  • Savings Plans - The purchase of a savings plan results in the addition of distinct columns to your CUR. Many of our queries rely on these columns to accurately represent your spend.
  • Cost Allocation Tags - Defining a cost allocation tag results in its persistence in your CUR dataset. For our queries to function correctly, it is imperative to have at least one cost allocation tag enabled.

VERIFIED indicates the presence of the columns in your CUR. FAILED indicates the absence of these columns, and as a result, certain visuals in the dashboard may not function as expected. If this is a new CUR it may take 24 hours for column data to populate.

panels.description: This table will display TRUE if the required savings plans, reservation and cost allocation columns exist within your dataset.

targets.rawSQL:
with user_tag_columns as ( -- count cost allocation tags
SELECT 
COUNT(*) OVER (PARTITION BY column_name) AS user_tag_column_count
FROM information_schema.columns
WHERE 
table_name = '$CurTable'
AND column_name LIKE 'resource_tags_user_%'  
),

savings_plans_columns as ( -- check for savings plans column
SELECT 
COUNT(*) OVER (PARTITION BY column_name) AS savings_plans_column_count
FROM information_schema.columns
WHERE 
table_name = '$CurTable'
AND column_name = 'savings_plan_savings_plan_effective_cost'  
),

reservation_columns as ( -- check for reservation column
SELECT 
COUNT(*) OVER (PARTITION BY column_name) AS reservation_column_count
FROM information_schema.columns
WHERE 
table_name = '$CurTable'
AND column_name LIKE 'reservation_effective_cost'  
)

SELECT 
CASE
    WHEN (SELECT SUM(user_tag_column_count) FROM user_tag_columns) > 0 THEN 'VERIFIED' ELSE 'FAILED' 
END AS user_tag_columns,
CASE 
    WHEN (SELECT SUM(savings_plans_column_count) FROM savings_plans_columns) > 0 THEN 'VERIFIED' ELSE 'FAILED' 
END AS savings_plans_columns,
CASE
    WHEN (SELECT SUM(reservation_column_count) FROM reservation_columns) > 0 THEN 'VERIFIED' ELSE 'FAILED' 
END AS reservation_columns

panels.title: CUR Columns Validator

options.content:
The Invoice View section displays invoice amounts and will match the amounts in your AWS Bills page. It is only reactive to the date, linked accounts and regions filters (not tagging).
For more billing details navigate to the: Account Billing Page

panels.description: Last two invoices - Top 10

targets.rawSQL:
with spend_difference as (
    SELECT
    line_item_usage_account_id as account,
    SUM(
        CASE
        WHEN(bill_billing_period_start_date = date_add('MONTH', -1, DATE_TRUNC('MONTH', current_date))) THEN line_item_unblended_cost
    END) as cost_one_month_ago,
    SUM(
        CASE
        WHEN(bill_billing_period_start_date = date_add('MONTH', -2, DATE_TRUNC('MONTH', current_date))) THEN line_item_unblended_cost
    END) as cost_two_months_ago
    FROM
    $CurTable
    where
    ( bill_billing_period_start_date = date_add('MONTH', -1, DATE_TRUNC('MONTH', current_date)) 
    OR bill_billing_period_start_date = date_add('MONTH', -2, DATE_TRUNC('MONTH', current_date)) )
    AND product_location in ($Regions)
    AND line_item_usage_account_id IN ($LinkedAccounts)
    Group by 
    line_item_usage_account_id
    ORDER BY 
    account DESC
    LIMIT 10
)

SELECT
    account,
    (((cost_one_month_ago - cost_two_months_ago) / cost_two_months_ago) * 100) as spend_percentage_diff
FROM
spend_difference
ORDER BY spend_percentage_diff

panels.title: Top 10 Account Trends

panels.description: Last Month

targets.rawSQL:
SELECT 
CAST(line_item_usage_account_id as varchar) as account,
CAST(sum(line_item_unblended_cost) as integer) as spend
FROM $CurTable
where
bill_billing_period_start_date = date_add('MONTH', -1, date_trunc('MONTH', current_date))
AND product_location in ($Regions)
AND line_item_usage_account_id IN ($LinkedAccounts)
GROUP BY
line_item_usage_account_id
ORDER BY 
spend DESC
LIMIT 10

panels.title: Top 10 Accounts - Invoice Last Month

panels.description: The invoice panel allows for filtering by accounts and regions only.  This panel displays the current number of accounts and regions used to calculate the invoice sums.

targets.rawSQL:
SELECT 
COUNT(DISTINCT(line_item_usage_account_id)) as Accounts,
COUNT(DISTINCT(product_location)) as Regions
FROM $CurTable
WHERE 
product_location in ($Regions)
AND line_item_usage_account_id IN ($LinkedAccounts)

panels.title: Selected for invoice

options.content:
Total linked accounts in AWS Organization: ${TotalAccountInOrganization}

Percentage of spend from top 10 accounts: ${PanelTop25SpendPercentage}%

panels.description: Invoice trend over the past two months

targets.rawSQL:
-- Output the bill sum from jan of this year and last month
WITH bill_sum_ytd_and_last_month as (
  SELECT 
  SUM(CASE
        WHEN (bill_billing_period_start_date = date_add('YEAR', 0, DATE_TRUNC('YEAR', current_date))) THEN line_item_unblended_cost ELSE 0 
      END) AS bill_january,
  SUM(CASE
        WHEN (bill_billing_period_start_date = date_add('MONTH', -1, DATE_TRUNC('MONTH', current_date))) THEN line_item_unblended_cost ELSE 0 
      END) AS bill_one_month_ago
  FROM $CurTable
  where
  ( bill_billing_period_start_date = date_add('YEAR', 0, DATE_TRUNC('YEAR', current_date))
  OR bill_billing_period_start_date = date_add('MONTH', -1, DATE_TRUNC('MONTH', current_date)) )  
  AND product_location in ($Regions)
  AND line_item_usage_account_id IN ($LinkedAccounts)
),

-- output percentage change ytd
bill_percentage_change as (
  SELECT 
    bill_january,
    bill_one_month_ago,
    CAST(bill_one_month_ago - bill_january as double) as spend_difference,
    CAST(((bill_one_month_ago - bill_january) / bill_january) * 100 as double) as percentage_change
  FROM 
  bill_sum_ytd_and_last_month
)

SELECT 
percentage_change
FROM 
bill_percentage_change

panels.description: Invoice trend over the past two months

targets.rawSQL:
-- Output the bill sum last two months
WITH bill_sum_last_two_months as (
  SELECT 
  SUM(CASE
        WHEN (bill_billing_period_start_date = date_add('MONTH', -2, DATE_TRUNC('MONTH', current_date))) THEN line_item_unblended_cost ELSE 0 
      END) AS bill_two_months_ago,
  SUM(CASE
        WHEN (bill_billing_period_start_date = date_add('MONTH', -1, DATE_TRUNC('MONTH', current_date))) THEN line_item_unblended_cost ELSE 0 
      END) AS bill_one_month_ago
  FROM $CurTable
  where
  ( bill_billing_period_start_date = date_add('MONTH', -2, DATE_TRUNC('MONTH', current_date))
  OR bill_billing_period_start_date = date_add('MONTH', -1, DATE_TRUNC('MONTH', current_date)) )  
  AND product_location in ($Regions)
  AND line_item_usage_account_id IN ($LinkedAccounts)
),

-- output percentage change for bill in last two months
bill_percentage_change as (
SELECT 
  bill_two_months_ago,
  bill_one_month_ago,
  CAST(bill_one_month_ago - bill_two_months_ago as double) as spend_difference,
  CAST(((bill_one_month_ago - bill_two_months_ago) / bill_two_months_ago) * 100 as double) as percentage_change
FROM 
bill_sum_last_two_months
)

SELECT 
percentage_change
FROM 
bill_percentage_change

-- Output number for last months bill
SELECT 
SUM(line_item_unblended_cost)
FROM $CurTable
where
bill_billing_period_start_date = date_add('MONTH', -1, DATE_TRUNC('MONTH', current_date) )
AND product_location in ($Regions)
AND line_item_usage_account_id IN ($LinkedAccounts)

-- Output number for last months bill
SELECT 
SUM(line_item_unblended_cost)
FROM $CurTable
where
bill_billing_period_start_date = date_add('MONTH', -2, DATE_TRUNC('MONTH', current_date) )
AND product_location in ($Regions)
AND line_item_usage_account_id IN ($LinkedAccounts)

panels.description:
Total spend by service as represented by  SUM of line_item_unblended_cost.

Top 5 namely, remaning grouped under Others.

Select a service to apply filter to dashboard, or Others to clear service filtering.

targets.rawSQL:
SELECT
  date_trunc('$Granularity', line_item_usage_start_date),
   line_item_product_code as product,
  sum(line_item_unblended_cost) as cost
from $CurTable
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(line_item_usage_start_date)
  and product_location in ($Regions)
  AND line_item_usage_account_id IN ($LinkedAccounts)
  AND line_item_product_code in ($Services)
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
  AND line_item_line_item_type IN ($ChargeType)
  AND line_item_unblended_cost > 0
GROUP BY 1, 2
ORDER BY 1
;

panels.title: Total Spend Per Service

panels.description: Total spend trend as represented by SUM of line_item_unblended_cost aggregated by bill_billing_period_start_date (monthly).

targets.rawSQL:
WITH top_services AS (
SELECT
line_item_product_code,
sum(line_item_unblended_cost)

FROM $CurTable

WHERE
  $__timeFilter(line_item_usage_start_date)
  and product_location in ($Regions)
  AND line_item_usage_account_id IN ($LinkedAccounts)
  AND $CurTable .line_item_product_code in ($Services)
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
  AND line_item_line_item_type IN ($ChargeType)

GROUP BY 1
ORDER BY 2 DESC

LIMIT 5)

SELECT
  date_trunc('$Granularity', line_item_usage_start_date),
  $CurTable.line_item_product_code as product,
  sum($CurTable.line_item_unblended_cost) as cost
from $CurTable join top_services on $CurTable.line_item_product_code = top_services.line_item_product_code
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(line_item_usage_start_date)
  and product_location in ($Regions)
  AND line_item_usage_account_id IN ($LinkedAccounts)
  AND $CurTable .line_item_product_code in ($Services)
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
  AND line_item_line_item_type IN ($ChargeType)
  AND $CurTable.line_item_unblended_cost > 0
GROUP BY 1, 2
ORDER BY 1, 3
;

panels.title: Monthly Spend for Period - Top 5 Services

panels.description: Total spend trend as represented by SUM of line_item_unblended_cost aggregated by bill_billing_period_start_date (monthly).

targets.rawSQL:
WITH top_services AS (
SELECT
line_item_product_code,
sum(line_item_unblended_cost)

FROM $CurTable

WHERE
  $__timeFilter(line_item_usage_start_date)
  and product_location in ($Regions)
  AND line_item_usage_account_id IN ($LinkedAccounts)
  AND $CurTable .line_item_product_code in ($Services)
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
  AND line_item_line_item_type IN ($ChargeType)

GROUP BY 1
ORDER BY 2 DESC

LIMIT 5)

SELECT
  date_trunc('$Granularity', line_item_usage_start_date),
  $CurTable.line_item_product_code as product,
  sum($CurTable.line_item_unblended_cost) as cost
from $CurTable left outer join top_services on $CurTable.line_item_product_code = top_services.line_item_product_code
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(line_item_usage_start_date)
  AND top_services.line_item_product_code IS NULL
  and product_location in ($Regions)
  AND line_item_usage_account_id IN ($LinkedAccounts)
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
  AND line_item_line_item_type IN ($ChargeType)
  AND $CurTable.line_item_unblended_cost > 0
GROUP BY 1, 2
ORDER BY 1, 3
;

panels.title: Monthly Spend for Period - Other Services

panels.description: Spend per region as represented by  SUM of line_item_unblended_cost.

targets.rawSQL:
select 
  date_trunc('$Granularity', line_item_usage_start_date),
  product_location as location,
  sum(line_item_unblended_cost) as cost
from $CurTable

WHERE
  $__timeFilter(line_item_usage_start_date)
  AND line_item_product_code in ($Services)
  AND line_item_usage_account_id IN ($LinkedAccounts)
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
  AND line_item_line_item_type IN ($ChargeType)
  AND product_location IN ($Regions)
  AND line_item_unblended_cost > 0
GROUP BY 1, 2
ORDER BY 1, 3 desc
;

panels.title: Total Region Spend

panels.description: Total spend per region as represented by  SUM of line_item_unblended_cost aggregated by bill_billing_period_start_date (per $Granularity).

targets.rawSQL:
WITH top_regions AS (
SELECT
product_location,
sum(line_item_unblended_cost)

FROM $CurTable

WHERE
$__timeFilter(line_item_usage_start_date)
AND product_location in ($Regions)

GROUP BY 1
ORDER BY 2 DESC

LIMIT 5)

select 
  date_trunc('$Granularity', line_item_usage_start_date),
  product_location as location,
  sum(line_item_unblended_cost) as cost
from $CurTable join top_regions using (product_location)

WHERE
  $__timeFilter(line_item_usage_start_date)
  AND line_item_product_code in ($Services)
  AND line_item_usage_account_id IN ($LinkedAccounts)
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
  AND line_item_line_item_type IN ($ChargeType)
GROUP BY 1, 2
ORDER BY 1, 3
;

panels.title: Monthly Spend for Region - Top 5 Services

panels.description: Total spend trend as represented by SUM of line_item_unblended_cost aggregated by bill_billing_period_start_date (monthly).

targets.rawSQL:
WITH top_regions AS (
SELECT
product_location,
sum(line_item_unblended_cost)

FROM $CurTable

WHERE
$__timeFilter(line_item_usage_start_date)
AND product_location in ($Regions)

GROUP BY 1
ORDER BY 2 DESC

LIMIT 5)

select 
  date_trunc('$Granularity', line_item_usage_start_date),
  $CurTable.product_location as location,
  sum(line_item_unblended_cost) as cost
from $CurTable left outer join top_regions on $CurTable.product_location = top_regions.product_location

WHERE
  $__timeFilter(line_item_usage_start_date)
  AND top_regions.product_location is NULL
  AND $CurTable .product_location in ($Regions)
  AND line_item_product_code in ($Services)
  AND line_item_usage_account_id IN ($LinkedAccounts)
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
  AND line_item_line_item_type IN ($ChargeType)
GROUP BY 1, 2
ORDER BY 1, 3
;

panels.title: Monthly Spend for Period - Other Services

panels.description: Amortized breakdown of On-Demand, Reserved and Savings plan for Amazon EC2.

targets.rawSQL:
SELECT 
  date_trunc('$Granularity', line_item_usage_start_date),
  SUM(CAST(CASE
    WHEN line_item_line_item_type IN ('Usage') AND line_item_usage_type NOT LIKE '%SpotUsage%' THEN line_item_unblended_cost
    ELSE 0
    END AS DOUBLE)) AS "On-Demand",
  SUM(CAST(savings_plan_savings_plan_effective_cost AS DOUBLE)) AS "Savings Plan",
  SUM(CAST(reservation_effective_cost AS DOUBLE)) AS "Reserved",
  SUM(CAST(CASE
    WHEN line_item_usage_type LIKE '%SpotUsage%' THEN line_item_unblended_cost
    ELSE 0
    END AS DOUBLE)) AS "Spot"
FROM 
  $CurTable
WHERE 
  $__timeFilter(line_item_usage_start_date)
  and product_location in ($Regions)
  AND  line_item_product_code in ($Services)
  AND line_item_usage_account_id IN ($LinkedAccounts)
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
  AND line_item_line_item_type IN ($ChargeType)
  AND line_item_product_code = 'AmazonEC2'
  AND line_item_operation LIKE '%RunInstance%'
  -- AND line_item_line_item_type IN ('Usage','SavingsPlanCoveredUsage', 'Fee','RIFee','DiscountedUsage')
  AND product_product_family NOT IN ('Data Transfer')
GROUP BY 
  1

panels.title: EC2 Total

panels.description: Amortized breakdown of On-Demand, Reserved and Savings plan for Amazon EC2.

targets.rawSQL:
SELECT 
  date_trunc('$Granularity', line_item_usage_start_date),
  SUM(CAST(CASE
    WHEN line_item_line_item_type IN ('Usage') AND line_item_usage_type NOT LIKE '%SpotUsage%' THEN line_item_unblended_cost
    ELSE 0
    END AS DOUBLE)) AS "On-Demand",
  SUM(CAST(savings_plan_savings_plan_effective_cost AS DOUBLE)) AS "Savings Plan",
  SUM(CAST(reservation_effective_cost AS DOUBLE)) AS "Reserved",
  SUM(CAST(CASE
    WHEN line_item_usage_type LIKE '%SpotUsage%' THEN line_item_unblended_cost
    ELSE 0
    END AS DOUBLE)) AS "Spot"
FROM 
  $CurTable
WHERE 
  $__timeFilter(line_item_usage_start_date)
  and product_location in ($Regions)
  AND  line_item_product_code in ($Services)
  AND line_item_usage_account_id IN ($LinkedAccounts)
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
  AND line_item_line_item_type IN ($ChargeType)
  AND line_item_product_code = 'AmazonEC2'
  AND line_item_operation LIKE '%RunInstance%'
  -- AND line_item_line_item_type IN ('Usage','SavingsPlanCoveredUsage', 'Fee','RIFee','DiscountedUsage')
  AND product_product_family NOT IN ('Data Transfer')
GROUP BY 
  1

panels.title: EC2 Over Time

panels.description: Breakdown of Amazon RDS On-Demand and Reserved Instance Coverage

targets.rawSQL:
SELECT 
  date_trunc('$Granularity', line_item_usage_start_date),
  SUM(CAST(CASE
    WHEN line_item_line_item_type IN ('Usage') THEN line_item_unblended_cost
    ELSE 0
    END AS DOUBLE)) AS "On-Demand",
  SUM(CAST(reservation_effective_cost AS DOUBLE)) AS "Reserved",
  SUM(CAST(reservation_unused_amortized_upfront_fee_for_billing_period AS DOUBLE) + CAST(reservation_unused_recurring_fee AS DOUBLE)) AS "Unused Reserved"
FROM 
  $CurTable
WHERE 
  $__timeFilter(line_item_usage_start_date)
  and product_location in ($Regions)
  AND  line_item_product_code in ($Services)
  AND line_item_usage_account_id IN ($LinkedAccounts)
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
  AND line_item_line_item_type IN ($ChargeType)
  AND line_item_product_code = 'AmazonRDS'
  -- AND line_item_line_item_type IN ('Usage','Fee','RIFee','DiscountedUsage')
  AND product_product_family NOT IN ('Data Transfer')
GROUP BY 
  1

panels.title: ElastiCache Purchase Type Coverage -  Amortized

panels.description: Breakdown of Amazon Redshift On-Demand and Reserved Instance Coverage

targets.rawSQL:
SELECT 
  date_trunc('$Granularity', line_item_usage_start_date),
  SUM(CAST(CASE
    WHEN line_item_line_item_type IN ('Usage') THEN line_item_unblended_cost
    ELSE 0
    END AS DOUBLE)) AS "On-Demand",
  SUM(CAST(reservation_effective_cost AS DOUBLE)) AS "Reserved",
  SUM(CAST(reservation_unused_amortized_upfront_fee_for_billing_period AS DOUBLE) + CAST(reservation_unused_recurring_fee AS DOUBLE)) AS "Unused Reserved"
FROM 
  $CurTable
WHERE 
  $__timeFilter(line_item_usage_start_date)
  and product_location in ($Regions)
  AND  line_item_product_code in ($Services)
  AND line_item_usage_account_id IN ($LinkedAccounts)
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
  AND line_item_line_item_type IN ($ChargeType)
  AND line_item_product_code = 'AmazonRedshift'
  -- AND line_item_line_item_type IN ('Usage','Fee','RIFee','DiscountedUsage')
  AND product_product_family NOT IN ('Data Transfer')
GROUP BY 
  1

panels.title: Redshift Purchase Type Coverage -  Amortized

panels.description:
This table allows you to parse your savings plan at the set granularity.  It reports the purchasing account and the percentage utilized.  This table allows only the linked_account,  granularity and tag filters.

The linked account filter will display where the savings plan was used.
The tag filter will display the savings plans which were utilized by the tag.

targets.rawSQL:
SELECT
  date_trunc('$Granularity', line_item_usage_start_date) as usage_month,
  -- DATE_FORMAT((line_item_usage_start_date),'%Y-%m') AS usage_month,
    -- (used commitment / total commitment) * 100 = utilization %
  TRY_CAST(((SUM(TRY_CAST(savings_plan_used_commitment AS DECIMAL(16, 8))) / SUM(TRY_CAST(savings_plan_total_commitment_to_date AS DOUBLE))) * 100) AS DECIMAL(3, 0)) AS "savings_plan_utilization",
  savings_plan_end_time AS "expiration_date",
  SPLIT_PART(savings_plan_savings_plan_a_r_n, '/', 2) AS "plan_id",
  bill_payer_account_id AS "payer_account_number",
  SPLIT_PART(savings_plan_savings_plan_a_r_n, ':', 5) AS "purchasing_account_number",
  savings_plan_offering_type AS "offering_type",
  savings_plan_region AS "region",
  -- DATE_FORMAT(FROM_ISO8601_TIMESTAMP(savings_plan_start_time),'%Y-%m-%d') AS day_savings_plan_start_time,
  savings_plan_payment_option AS "payment_option",
  savings_plan_purchase_term AS "purchase_term",
  SUM(TRY_CAST(savings_plan_total_commitment_to_date AS DOUBLE)) AS "amortized_total_commitment_to_date", 
  SUM(TRY_CAST(savings_plan_used_commitment AS DOUBLE)) AS "used_commitment",
  AVG(CASE
    WHEN line_item_line_item_type = 'SavingsPlanRecurringFee' THEN TRY_CAST(savings_plan_total_commitment_to_date AS DOUBLE)
  END) AS "Hourly Commitment"
FROM
  $CurTable
WHERE 
  $__timeFilter(line_item_usage_start_date)
  AND line_item_usage_account_id IN ($LinkedAccounts)
  -- and product_location in ($Regions)
  -- AND  line_item_product_code in ($Services)
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
  -- AND line_item_line_item_type IN ($ChargeType)
  AND savings_plan_savings_plan_a_r_n <> ''
  AND (line_item_line_item_type = 'SavingsPlanRecurringFee' OR line_item_line_item_type = 'SavingsPlanCoveredUsage')
GROUP BY
  -- SPLIT_PART(savings_plan_savings_plan_a_r_n, '/', 2),
  1, 3, 4, 5, 6,
  savings_plan_offering_type,
  savings_plan_region,
  -- DATE_FORMAT(FROM_ISO8601_TIMESTAMP(savings_plan_start_time),'%Y-%m-%d'),
  savings_plan_end_time,
  savings_plan_payment_option,
  savings_plan_purchase_term
ORDER BY
  usage_month DESC,
  savings_plan_utilization ASC,
  savings_plan_end_time DESC;

query.rawSQL: select distinct product_location from $CurTable where product_location != '';

list.label: Granularity
list.name: Granularity

query.rawSQL: SELECT DISTINCT(resource_tags_user_$TagKey) FROM $CurTable WHERE resource_tags_user_$TagKey IS NOT NULL AND NOT resource_tags_user_$TagKey = '';

list.description: Calculate the spend percentage from the top 25 accounts in the AWS Organization.
list.name: PanelTop25SpendPercentage

query.rawSQL:
with total_spend as (
    SELECT
    line_item_usage_account_id as account,
    sum(line_item_unblended_cost) as total_spend
    FROM
    $CurTable
    where
    bill_billing_period_start_date = date_add('MONTH', -1, DATE_TRUNC('MONTH', current_date))
    Group by 
    line_item_usage_account_id
),

top10_spend as (
    SELECT
    line_item_usage_account_id as account,
    sum(line_item_unblended_cost) as top25_spend
    FROM
    $CurTable
    where
    bill_billing_period_start_date = date_add('MONTH', -1, DATE_TRUNC('MONTH', current_date))
    Group by 
    line_item_usage_account_id
    LIMIT 10
)


SELECT
    CAST( (sum(top10_spend) / sum(total_spend) * 100) as VARCHAR) as percentage_from_top25
FROM
    total_spend
INNER JOIN top10_spend ON total_spend.account = top10_spend.account;

SELECT 
CAST(COUNT(DISTINCT(line_item_usage_account_id)) as VARCHAR) as account_count
FROM 
$CurTable
